ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course to other students. It is a marvelous opportunity to work with a manuscript under the supervision of an expert in medieval law, meaning that many of the issues that arise in working with manuscripts can and will be encountered while benefiting from the guidance of an experienced scholar.

This course is a summary of major developments in Medieval legal systems, with an added focus on medieval manuscripts and their role in writing the history of medieval law. I would recommend this course to another student.
History 542 is a graduate methods course with a pronounced practical component which also serves as an overview of the history of medieval law.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course did not fall within my area of specialization, but it was nevertheless very helpful both in terms of thinking about the law and facing the issues involved in working with manuscript sources.
